section.para: Accounts are central to the CRM. An Account holds information about an entity and serves to define it further as a Customer, Prospect, Vendor, Competitor, or Partner. To create a new Account, select the "New CRM Account" option. The following screen will appear.
When creating a new Account, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: The Account Number uniquely identifies the CRM Account.
Enter the name of the Account you do business with (e.g., Customer Name or Vendor Name). This field should not to be confused with the Contact name of an individual at the company.
Select if you are actively doing business with this Account. Not selecting makes the Account inactive.
Enter the Account Number of the CRM Account (if any) which serves as the parent for the Account.
Specify one of the following Account Types:
Organization: Select if the Account is an organization.
Individual: Select if the Account is an individual.
Indicate how the Account relates to your business by selecting from the available options. You may select multiple relationships from the list:

Customer: Select if the Account is a Customer Account. If selected, Account information--including the Account Number, Account Name, and Contact information--will be used to populate a Customer master. You will be prompted to edit the Customer master if no Customer relationship existed previously.
Prospect: Select if the Account is a Prospect. The CRM Account serves as the master record for Prospects.
Neither: Select if the Account is neither a Customer nor a Prospect. The CRM Account serves as the master record for Accounts falling in this category.

Vendor: Select if the Account is a Vendor Account. If selected, Account information--including the Account Number, Account Name, and Contact information--will be used to populate a Vendor master. You will be prompted to edit the Vendor master if no Vendor relationship existed previously.
Partner: Select if the Account is a Partner. The CRM Account serves as the master record for Partners.
Competitor: Select if the Account is a Competitor. The CRM Account serves as the master record for Competitors.
Tax Authority: Select if the Account is a Tax Authority. The CRM Account serves as the master record for Tax Authorities.

tip.para: For Contacts, you have two options: 1) Associate an existing Contact with the Account or 2) enter new Contact information. If a new Contact is entered, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts.

listitem.para: Manually enter Contact information in the fields below--or use the browse button to select pre-existing Contact information.
Title: Select a Title from the list of available Titles.
First: Enter the Contact's first name.
Last: Enter the Contact's last name.
Job Title: Enter the Contact's job title.
Voice: Enter the Contact's phone number.
Fax: Enter the Contact's fax number.
E-Mail: Enter the Contact's e-mail address.

section.para: Contacts are people who may be associated with CRM Accounts. To enter or associate Contacts with a CRM Account, select the "Contacts" tab. The following screen will appear:

listitem.para: Displays all Contacts associated with the CRM Account.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Opens screen for creating a new Contact.

note.para: If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts.

listitem.para: Enables you to edit highlighted Contacts. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Contact--except that when editing, the fields will contain Contact information. Double-clicking on a Contact will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Contact and then select this button to remove the association between the Contact and the CRM Account.
Select to associate a new Contact with the CRM Account.

To enter or associate To-Dos and/or Incidents with a CRM Account, select the "To-Do List" tab. The following screen will appear:
When entering or associating To-Dos and/or Incidents with a CRM Account, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to include To-Dos in the display.
If not selected, To-Dos will not be included.
Select to include Incidents in the display.
If not selected, Incidents will not be included.
Select to include only active To-Dos in the display.
If not selected, inactive To-Dos will not be included.
Select to include completed Incidents in the display.
An Incident is considered completed when its status is "Closed." If this option is not selected, then completed Incidents will not be included.
Displays To-Dos associated with the Account.
